name: Calculus(I)
description: Apply fundamental concepts of differential and integral calculus to address computational challenges within informatics. Students will develop analytical skills crucial for algorithm complexity analysis, optimizing software performance, and understanding continuous system modeling.

name: Introduction to Computer Science
description: Explore fundamental computer science concepts, including algorithmic problem-solving and foundational programming principles. Students will develop practical skills in implementing basic data structures and designing simple software solutions, preparing them for advanced studies and careers in various tech fields.

name: Computer Programming(I)
description: Develop foundational programming skills and algorithmic thinking crucial for modern software development. Students will learn procedural programming concepts, including data types, control structures, and basic debugging, to solve computational problems effectively. This course prepares students for more advanced computer science topics and entry-level programming roles.

name: Intellectual Property
description: Examine the core principles of intellectual property (IP) law as they apply to the creation, development, and commercialization of software and digital innovations. Students will learn to navigate copyright, patent, and trade secret protections for their algorithms, source code, and data, preparing them for responsible innovation and entrepreneurship in the tech industry.

description: Develop crucial academic English proficiency, focusing on advanced listening comprehension for technical lectures and critical reading skills for informatics-related research papers and documentation. This course equips students with the linguistic tools necessary for effectively processing complex scientific information and communicating professionally within the global computing landscape.

name: Linear Algebra
description: Explore the foundational concepts of linear algebra, including vectors, matrices, and transformations, essential for understanding data structures and algorithms in computer science. This course equips students with the mathematical tools necessary for fields like machine learning, computer graphics, and optimization problems inherent in software development.

name: Data Structures
description: Master fundamental data structures such as arrays, linked lists, and trees, alongside essential algorithmic analysis techniques. This course equips students with the programming skills necessary to design and implement efficient, scalable software solutions for complex computational problems, a critical skill for careers in software development and data engineering.

name: Introduction to Data Communications
description: Analyze the foundational concepts of data communication and network architectures crucial for modern software development. This course equips students with practical understanding of network protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, HTTP) and introduces principles of secure data transmission and network programming, essential for building robust, distributed applications.

name: Digital System Design
description: Explores the foundational principles of digital system design, focusing on data representation, Boolean logic, and state machine concepts essential for understanding modern computing architectures. This course develops problem-solving skills critical for designing efficient software components and optimizing algorithmic performance at a fundamental level.

name: Web Programming
description: Develop foundational skills in modern web programming, encompassing both client-side and server-side development principles. Students will learn to implement dynamic web applications by mastering client-side scripting, server-side logic, and database integration. This practical course prepares students to build robust and interactive web solutions critical for contemporary software development roles.

name: Introduction to Computer Networks
description: Examine the fundamental principles of computer networks, encompassing the TCP/IP model, common network protocols, and client-server communication architectures. This course develops practical skills in network programming and analysis, essential for designing secure, distributed software systems and pursuing careers in network engineering or software development.

name: Introduction to Compiler
description: Explore the fundamental principles and algorithms governing the translation of high-level programming languages into executable code. This course provides practical experience in designing and implementing compiler phases such as lexical analysis, parsing, and code generation, equipping students with essential skills for advanced software development and system programming careers.

description: Develop practical skills in embedded system design by applying computer science fundamentals to hardware-software integration. This course covers low-level programming, real-time operating systems, and hardware-software interfacing, preparing students to build robust embedded solutions for various industrial and IoT applications.

name: Service and Technology Management
description: Provides comprehensive coverage of Service and Technology Management, integrating theoretical concepts with practical applications relevant to International Bachelor Program in Informatics.

name: Introduction to Computer Science

name: Data Structures
description: Explore fundamental data structures such as linked lists, trees, and hash tables, and learn to analyze their performance characteristics for efficient algorithm design. This course equips students with essential tools for building scalable and robust software solutions in a professional context.

description: Develop a foundational understanding of probability and statistical inference essential for data-driven decision-making in computer science. name: Introduction to Data Communications

name: Linear Algebra

Students will develop practical skills in visual hierarchy, color theory, and prototyping techniques using industry-standard software. This course prepares students for careers in web design, user interface (UI) development, and digital media production.

name: Data Structure
description: Explore fundamental data structures—including linked lists, trees, and hash tables—and their practical application in multimedia systems, digital communication protocols, and interactive interface design. Develop skills in algorithm analysis and implementation to optimize performance for resource-intensive applications common in the Information Communication field. This course prepares students for roles requiring efficient data management and problem-solving in dynamic, user-centered technologies.

name: Design History
description: Explore the evolution of design principles impacting contemporary multimedia, digital communication, and human-computer interaction. Students will analyze historical precedents to inform current practices in user interface (UI) design, information architecture, and visual communication strategies – developing critical thinking skills essential for effective design solutions. This course equips future professionals with a contextual understanding to navigate and contribute to the rapidly changing landscape of digital media.

name: Introduction to Computer Science
description: Explore the foundational principles of computer science with a focus on multimedia design, digital communication, and human-computer interaction. Students will develop practical skills in visual programming, basic web development (HTML/CSS), and data representation, preparing them for careers in dynamic fields like digital media and user experience design. This course provides a strong base for further study in information communication technologies.

name: Computer Programming(I)
description: Develop foundational programming skills essential for careers in multimedia design and digital communication through IC184. This course introduces core concepts like data types, control structures, and basic algorithm design, utilizing Vietnamese-language instruction to build proficiency in creating interactive applications. Students will gain practical experience applicable to human-computer interaction and web development projects.

name: Principles of Animation
description: Explore foundational principles of animation within the context of modern multimedia design and digital communication. Students will develop practical skills in keyframing, tweening, and visual storytelling techniques using industry-standard software, preparing them for careers in interactive media and human-computer interaction. This course emphasizes creating compelling animated content for effective digital experiences.

name: Computer Graphics Design
description: Develop foundational skills in computer graphics design for effective multimedia communication, exploring concepts like image manipulation, vector graphics, and basic 3D modeling. This course equips students with practical techniques for visual storytelling and user interface design, preparing them for careers in digital media and human-computer interaction. Students will utilize industry-standard software to create compelling visuals for diverse communication platforms.

name: Computer Programming
description: Develop foundational programming skills essential for multimedia design and digital communication through IC212. This course introduces core concepts like data structures, algorithm design, and object-oriented programming using a relevant language, preparing students for careers in human-computer interaction and software development. Students will apply these skills to build interactive applications and solve practical communication challenges.

name: General Physics
description: Explore the fundamental principles of physics as they apply to information and communication technologies, focusing on concepts crucial for multimedia design and human-computer interaction. Students will develop practical skills in signal processing, optics for display technologies, and basic mechanics for sensor integration – preparing them for careers in digital communication and interactive media. This course equips students with a technical foundation to innovate in rapidly evolving fields.

name: Interactive Script Production
description: Develop compelling interactive narratives for digital platforms in IC225: Interactive Script Production. This course equips students with practical skills in storyboarding, scripting for branching narratives, and utilizing multimedia elements to enhance user engagement – crucial for careers in digital communication and human-computer interaction. Students will gain hands-on experience with scripting languages and interactive design principles to create effective and immersive experiences.

name: Windows Programming
description: Develop practical skills in designing and implementing Windows applications with a focus on multimedia integration and user interface development. This course covers fundamental concepts like event-driven programming, GUI design using Visual Studio, and basic Windows API utilization, preparing students for roles in digital communication and human-computer interaction. Students will build interactive applications relevant to modern communication technologies.

name: Game Planning
description: Develop strategic communication plans for interactive media through the application of user experience (UX) principles, visual design software, and basic scripting languages. IC242 equips students with practical skills in multimedia content creation and digital campaign management, preparing them for roles in game development, digital marketing, and human-computer interaction. This course emphasizes a project-based approach to build a professional portfolio demonstrating proficiency in interactive design.

name: Case Study on Cultural Industries
description: Analyze real-world case studies within Vietnam’s cultural industries, focusing on the application of multimedia design principles, digital communication strategies, and user experience (UX) design. Students will develop practical skills in content management systems (CMS), data analytics for audience engagement, and interactive prototyping tools to enhance cultural product development and digital storytelling. This course prepares graduates for careers in digital media production, cultural heritage management, and interactive communication within a rapidly evolving industry landscape.

name: Computer Programming Lab.(I)
description: Develop foundational programming skills essential for multimedia design and digital communication through hands-on laboratory exercises. Students will gain practical experience with fundamental concepts like data structures, algorithm design, and basic scripting languages – preparing them for roles in human-computer interaction and related fields. This course emphasizes applying programming principles to solve real-world challenges in the Information Communication sector.

name: Introduction of Human-Computer Interaction
description: Explore the foundations of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) and its application to multimedia design and digital communication, equipping students with practical skills in usability testing, interface prototyping, and information architecture. This course introduces core HCI principles to optimize user experiences and prepare students for careers in UX/UI design, web development, and related fields within the information communication industry. Students will learn to analyze user needs and translate them into effective, user-centered digital solutions.

name: Creative Media Practice
description: Explore the fundamentals of creative media production with a focus on multimedia design, digital communication strategies, and human-computer interaction principles. Students will develop practical skills in visual communication, video editing with software like Adobe Premiere Pro, and basic web design using HTML/CSS. This course prepares students for careers in digital content creation, marketing, and interactive media.

name: 3D Computer Graphics
description: Explore the principles of 3D modeling, texturing, and animation within the context of multimedia design and digital communication. This course equips students with practical skills in industry-standard software to create compelling visuals for applications in human-computer interaction and digital content creation. Students will develop a portfolio demonstrating proficiency in 3D graphics techniques essential for careers in game development, visualization, and interactive media.

name: Computer Programming Lab.
description: Develop foundational programming skills essential for multimedia design and digital communication through hands-on laboratory exercises. IC336 introduces core concepts like data structures, algorithm design, and basic scripting, preparing students for careers in human-computer interaction and related fields. name: 3D Computer Animation

This course, delivered in Vietnamese, explores human-computer interaction principles as applied to creating compelling animated content for various professional applications. name: Narrative and Storytelling
description: Explore the principles of compelling narrative construction for diverse digital platforms, focusing on multimedia design and effective communication strategies. name: Electric Circuits
description: Analyze and design fundamental electric circuits utilizing key concepts such as Kirchhoff’s Laws, Thevenin’s Theorem, and nodal/mesh analysis. description: Analyze and design power electronic circuits essential for modern electrical systems, focusing on applications in power supplies, motor drives, and renewable energy. description: Explore the fundamentals of Very Large Scale Integration (VLSI) design, focusing on electrical engineering principles applied to modern microchip fabrication. name: Introduction of Intelligent Control
description: Explore the fundamentals of intelligent control systems with a focus on electrical engineering principles and practical circuit design. This course prepares students for roles in automation, robotics, and advanced control systems engineering.

name: High-Level IC Design

This course prepares students for roles in communications, control systems, and signal processing industries.

name: Human-Computer Interaction

name: Electrical Power Distribution for Industry
description: Analyze and design electrical power distribution systems commonly found in industrial facilities, applying core electrical engineering principles. Students will develop proficiency in load flow analysis, protective relaying coordination, and harmonic mitigation techniques essential for ensuring reliable and efficient power delivery. This course prepares graduates for roles in industrial power systems engineering, maintenance, and operations.

name: Biomedical Engineering
description: Explore the application of electrical engineering principles to the biomedical field, focusing on the design and analysis of bioinstrumentation circuits. Students will develop skills in signal processing, medical imaging systems, and biosensor interfacing, preparing them for careers in medical device development and healthcare technology. This course emphasizes practical circuit implementation and problem-solving relevant to modern biomedical challenges.

name: Bioengineering Physiology
description: Explore the intersection of electrical engineering and human physiology, applying circuit analysis and signal processing techniques to model biological systems. Students will design and analyze bioinstrumentation, including biosensors and biomedical signal acquisition circuits, preparing them for careers in medical device development and healthcare technology. This course emphasizes practical application through simulations and prepares students for advanced work in bioengineering fields.

name: Graduation Project
description: Develop a comprehensive electrical engineering project applying principles of circuit analysis, embedded systems programming, and signal processing. Students will design, implement, and rigorously test a practical system, culminating in a professional-quality report and demonstration – preparing them for industry roles demanding independent engineering problem-solving. This capstone experience integrates theoretical knowledge with hands-on application for successful career entry.

name: Introduction to the Applications of Endoscopy and Ultrasound in Gastroenterology and Artificial Intelligence
description: Explore the intersection of electrical engineering and modern medicine by investigating the application of endoscopy and ultrasound technologies in gastroenterology, enhanced by artificial intelligence. Students will develop skills in signal processing, image reconstruction, and embedded systems design relevant to medical imaging devices. This course prepares students for careers in biomedical engineering, medical device development, and AI-driven healthcare solutions.

name: Calculus(I)
description: Develop a foundational understanding of calculus essential for electrical engineering, focusing on limits, derivatives, and integrals applied to circuit analysis and signal processing. Students will learn to model and solve fundamental engineering problems involving rates of change, optimization, and accumulation – skills critical for subsequent coursework in areas like circuit design and control systems. This course equips students with the mathematical tools necessary for a successful career in the field.

name: Introduction to Computer Science
description: Explore fundamental computer science principles with a focus on their application within electrical engineering, particularly in circuit design and embedded systems. Students will develop proficiency in Boolean algebra, logic gates, and basic programming concepts using a high-level language to model and simulate electrical circuits. This course provides a crucial foundation for careers in hardware development, automation, and related engineering fields.

name: Linear Algebra
description: Apply fundamental linear algebra concepts to analyze and solve circuit problems, including network analysis using matrices, signal processing with vector spaces, and system modeling via eigenvalue decomposition. Develop proficiency in techniques essential for electrical engineering applications such as Gaussian elimination, determinants, and linear transformations. This course prepares students for advanced coursework and practical challenges in areas like control systems and digital signal processing.

name: Probability for Engineers
description: Apply probabilistic methods to analyze and design electrical circuits, focusing on random variables, noise analysis, and reliability assessment. Students will develop skills in calculating probabilities, expected values, and statistical distributions essential for performance evaluation of communication systems and signal processing algorithms. This course prepares engineers for practical problem-solving in areas like circuit testing and system optimization.

name: General Physics
description: Explore fundamental physics principles essential for electrical engineering, with a strong emphasis on circuit analysis techniques like Ohm’s Law and Kirchhoff’s Laws. Develop practical skills in applying concepts of electromagnetism and DC/AC circuit theory to analyze and design basic electrical systems. This course provides a foundational skillset crucial for success in subsequent electrical engineering coursework and professional practice.

name: Programming Language Labs (I)
description: Develop foundational programming skills essential for electrical engineering applications through hands-on laboratory exercises. This course introduces students to fundamental concepts like data structures, algorithm design, and microcontroller interfacing using a relevant programming language – all within the context of circuit analysis and control systems. Successful completion prepares students for advanced coursework and practical roles in embedded systems development and automation.

name: Electronics(I)
description: Explore fundamental electrical engineering principles and develop practical circuit design skills using industry-standard tools. This course introduces students to key concepts like DC/AC circuit analysis, semiconductor devices, and basic electronic components – essential for careers in electronics and related fields. Students will gain hands-on experience through simulations and practical exercises, preparing them for more advanced coursework.

name: Engineering Mathematics(I)
description: Apply fundamental mathematical principles – including complex numbers, differential equations, and Laplace transforms – to analyze and model electrical circuits and systems. Develop essential problem-solving skills for circuit design, signal processing, and control systems analysis, preparing students for practical applications in electrical engineering. This course provides a strong mathematical foundation crucial for advanced study and professional practice.

name: Electronic Circuits Experiments(I)
description: Explore fundamental electronic circuit behavior through hands-on experimentation, developing proficiency in circuit analysis, component testing, and breadboarding techniques. Students will build and analyze basic circuits utilizing resistors, capacitors, and diodes, reinforcing core electrical engineering principles essential for practical applications and future design work. This course prepares students for advanced circuit design and laboratory practices within the field.

name: Circuit Theory
description: Analyze and design fundamental electrical circuits using techniques like Kirchhoff’s Laws, nodal and mesh analysis, and Thevenin/Norton equivalents. This course equips students with essential skills for modeling, simulating, and troubleshooting circuits commonly found in power systems, electronics, and control applications. Successful completion provides a strong foundation for advanced studies and practical engineering roles.

name: Dissection of Customer-Premises Equipment
description: Analyze the internal workings of common customer-premises electrical equipment, applying fundamental circuit analysis and troubleshooting techniques. Students will develop skills in schematic reading, component identification, and fault diagnosis through hands-on dissection and testing of devices. This course prepares students for roles in field service, maintenance, and electrical system design.

name: Front-end Web Technologies
description: Develop foundational skills in front-end web technologies, applying electrical engineering principles to user interface design and interactive circuit-based web applications. Students will gain practical experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to build responsive web elements and understand data transmission protocols relevant to embedded systems communication. This course prepares students for roles in developing web-integrated hardware interfaces and IoT solutions.

name: Basic MATLAB/Simulink Labs for EE/CS/CN Fields
description: Develop foundational programming skills in MATLAB/Simulink specifically tailored for electrical engineering, computer science, and computer networks applications. This course introduces students to circuit modeling, simulation, and data analysis techniques, including Fourier transforms and filter design, preparing them for practical problem-solving in industry and research. Students will gain hands-on experience implementing and analyzing algorithms relevant to signal processing and control systems.

name: Practical Python
description: Apply Python programming to solve practical problems in electrical engineering, focusing on circuit analysis, data visualization, and automated testing of electrical systems. Students will develop skills in scripting, numerical computation with NumPy, and data manipulation using Pandas to enhance efficiency in design and analysis workflows. This course prepares students for industry roles requiring computational proficiency in electrical engineering applications.

name: Communications System
description: Analyze and design fundamental communication systems, focusing on electrical engineering principles and circuit implementation. Students will develop skills in modulation techniques, signal processing, and noise analysis essential for modern wireless and wired communication technologies. This course prepares students for careers in telecommunications, signal engineering, and related fields.

name: Electromagnetics(II)
description: Analyze and apply advanced electromagnetic field theory to the design of practical electrical engineering systems. This course develops proficiency in transmission line theory, wave propagation, and antenna fundamentals, equipping students with essential skills for high-frequency circuit design and wireless communication applications. Students will utilize computational tools to model and simulate electromagnetic phenomena relevant to modern engineering challenges.

name: Operation Systems
description: Explore the foundational principles of operating systems with a focus on their hardware interactions and electrical engineering implementation. Students will develop skills in process management, memory organization, and interrupt handling, applying these concepts to embedded systems and real-time circuit design. This course prepares students for roles in software and hardware integration within the electrical engineering field.

name: Field Study(I)
description: Apply electrical engineering principles through hands-on field work, focusing on circuit analysis, signal processing, and practical instrumentation techniques. This course develops skills in troubleshooting, testing, and implementing electrical systems in real-world scenarios, preparing students for immediate contributions to industry. EEB314 emphasizes practical application and reinforces theoretical knowledge gained in prior coursework.

name: Introduction to multimedia communications
description: Explore the fundamental electrical engineering principles behind modern multimedia communication systems, focusing on signal modulation, digital filtering, and compression techniques. Students will design and analyze circuits for encoding, transmission, and decoding of audio and video signals, preparing them for roles in telecommunications and signal processing industries. This course provides a practical foundation for developing and implementing multimedia communication technologies.

name: Hardware Description Language
description: Develop proficiency in designing and simulating digital circuits using Hardware Description Languages (HDLs), primarily Verilog. Students will learn to model combinational and sequential logic, perform functional verification through testbenches, and synthesize designs for implementation on programmable logic devices – skills essential for modern hardware engineering roles. This course bridges theoretical electrical engineering principles with practical circuit design and validation techniques.

name: Introduction to Communications engineering
description: Explore fundamental principles of communications engineering with a focus on electrical circuit design and signal processing techniques. Students will develop skills in modulation, demodulation, and noise analysis, essential for modern communication systems. This course prepares students for careers in telecommunications, wireless networks, and related engineering fields.

name: Graduation Project
description: Develop a comprehensive electrical engineering project applying principles of circuit analysis, embedded systems programming, and power electronics. Students will independently design, implement, and test a functional prototype, culminating in a professional-quality report and demonstration – preparing them for industry roles demanding practical problem-solving skills. This capstone experience reinforces theoretical knowledge through hands-on application and project management.

name: Database Programming
description: Develop practical skills in database management essential for electrical engineering applications, focusing on data acquisition, storage, and retrieval for circuit design and analysis. Students will learn SQL programming, database normalization techniques, and implement database-driven control systems relevant to power systems and embedded applications. This course prepares students for roles involving data-intensive engineering projects and automation.

name: Projects of PCB Circuit Board Design and FPGA Firmware Development
description: Design and implement complete electronic systems through hands-on projects focusing on Printed Circuit Board (PCB) layout, Verilog/VHDL coding for Field-Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs), and circuit testing methodologies. Students will integrate hardware description language with physical circuit realization, developing skills crucial for embedded systems and digital design roles. This course prepares students for practical application of electrical engineering principles in modern technology development.

name: Space Science & Technology Applications
description: Explore the application of electrical engineering principles to space-based systems, focusing on spacecraft power systems, telemetry circuit design, and signal processing for remote sensing. Students will develop practical skills in modeling, simulation, and analysis of circuits operating in challenging space environments, preparing them for careers in aerospace and related industries. This course emphasizes hands-on projects and reinforces core EEB knowledge within a cutting-edge technological domain.

name: Introduction to Satellite Technology and Engineering
description: Explore the foundational principles of satellite technology with a focus on electrical engineering design and implementation. Students will develop skills in radio frequency (RF) circuit design, antenna theory, and satellite link budget analysis – crucial for careers in aerospace, telecommunications, and related fields. This course provides a practical introduction to the components and systems enabling modern satellite communication and observation.

name: AIoT Fundamentals
description: Explore the foundational principles of Artificial Intelligence of Things (AIoT) with a focus on electrical engineering implementation, including embedded systems design and sensor network integration. Students will develop practical skills in microcontroller programming, data acquisition techniques, and wireless communication protocols essential for building intelligent IoT devices. This course prepares students for careers in rapidly growing fields like smart manufacturing, precision agriculture, and smart city development.

name: Experiment of Antenna Design and Measurement
description: Design, build, and test practical antenna systems utilizing electromagnetic principles and circuit design techniques. Students will gain hands-on experience with antenna measurement methods, including Smith charting and VSWR analysis, preparing them for roles in wireless communication and RF engineering. This course emphasizes practical application of theoretical concepts to real-world antenna performance evaluation.

name: English for Science and Engineering
description: Develop advanced English communication skills specifically tailored for electrical engineering, focusing on precise technical writing and oral presentations related to circuit analysis, signal processing, and embedded systems. Students will practice composing professional reports, delivering effective presentations on engineering designs, and critically evaluating technical literature. This course prepares students for successful collaboration and leadership in a global engineering environment.

name: The Design and Applications of RF circuits
description: Analyze and design radio frequency (RF) circuits utilizing foundational electrical engineering principles, with emphasis on impedance matching, filter design, and amplifier stability. Students will gain practical experience in circuit simulation and measurement techniques essential for careers in wireless communication, aerospace, and related industries. This course prepares students to develop high-performance RF systems for modern applications.

name: The Introduction of Medical Technology
description: Explore the foundational electrical engineering principles underpinning modern medical technologies, with a focus on circuit design for biomedical applications. Students will develop skills in biosignal processing, medical instrumentation, and the implementation of safety standards relevant to patient-connected devices. This course prepares students for careers in the rapidly growing field of medical device development and healthcare technology.

name: Medical AI Workshop: Machine learning and Deep Learning in Medicine
description: Explore the application of machine learning and deep learning techniques to modern medical challenges, grounded in electrical engineering principles. Students will develop skills in signal processing, neural network implementation using hardware platforms, and data analysis for medical image classification and diagnostics. This workshop prepares students for careers in biomedical engineering and the rapidly growing field of medical AI.

name: General Physics(I)
description: Explore fundamental physics principles essential for electrical engineering, with a focus on mechanics, electricity, and magnetism as they apply to circuit analysis and design. Students will develop skills in applying Ohm’s Law, Kirchhoff’s Laws, and analyzing DC circuits – foundational competencies for future electrical engineering work. This course prepares students for advanced coursework and practical application in the field.

name: Calculus(I)
description: Develop a foundational understanding of differential and integral calculus essential for electrical engineering applications, including circuit analysis and signal processing. Students will master techniques for solving limits, derivatives, and integrals, and apply these to analyze transient and steady-state behavior in electrical circuits. This course prepares students for advanced coursework in areas like control systems and electromagnetic fields.

name: Introduction to Computer Science
description: Explore fundamental computer science principles with a focus on their application within electrical engineering, particularly in circuit design and embedded systems. Students will develop proficiency in Boolean algebra, logic gates, and basic programming concepts using a high-level language to model and analyze digital circuits. This course provides a crucial foundation for careers in hardware development, automation, and related engineering fields.

name: Programming Language Lab (I)
description: Develop foundational programming skills essential for electrical engineering applications through hands-on laboratory exercises. Students will learn to implement algorithms for circuit analysis, data acquisition, and control systems using a chosen programming language—strengthening their ability to model and simulate electrical systems. This course prepares students for advanced coursework and practical problem-solving in the field.

name: Introduction of Electronic Engineering
description: Explore the foundational principles of electrical engineering and develop essential skills in circuit analysis, component identification, and basic soldering techniques. This course introduces students to fundamental concepts like Ohm’s Law, Kirchhoff’s Laws, and series/parallel circuit configurations, preparing them for further study and careers in electronics-related fields. EEC115 provides a practical, hands-on introduction to the core elements of electronic systems.

name: Introduction to Semiconductor Electro-Optics
description: Explore the fundamental principles of semiconductor materials and their interaction with light in this introductory course, focusing on electrical engineering applications. Students will develop skills in analyzing optical detector circuits, understanding modulation techniques, and designing basic optoelectronic systems relevant to modern communication and sensing technologies. This course prepares students for careers in fields like telecommunications, photonics, and integrated optics.

name: Circuit Theory
description: Analyze and design fundamental electrical circuits using techniques like Kirchhoff’s Laws, nodal and mesh analysis, and Thevenin/Norton equivalents. This course equips students with essential skills for modeling, simulating, and troubleshooting circuits commonly found in power systems, electronics, and control applications. Successful completion provides a strong foundation for advanced studies and practical engineering work in the electrical field.

name: Engineering Mathematics(I)
description: Apply fundamental mathematical principles – including complex numbers, differential equations, and Laplace transforms – to analyze and model electrical circuits and systems. Develop essential problem-solving skills for circuit design, signal processing, and control systems commonly encountered in electrical engineering practice. This course provides a strong mathematical foundation crucial for advanced coursework and professional engineering applications.

name: Electronics(I)
description: Analyze fundamental electronic components and circuits, developing skills in circuit analysis using techniques like Kirchhoff’s Laws and Thevenin’s Theorem. Students will design, build, and test basic electronic circuits, gaining a practical foundation for careers in electrical engineering and related fields. This course provides essential knowledge of diodes, transistors, and operational amplifiers.

name: Electronic Circuits Lab.(I)
description: Develop foundational skills in electronic circuit analysis and design through hands-on experimentation. This laboratory course reinforces core electrical engineering principles, focusing on techniques for DC/AC circuit analysis, component characterization, and breadboard prototyping. Students will gain practical experience essential for roles in circuit design, testing, and troubleshooting.

name: Electromagnetics(I)
description: Analyze fundamental electromagnetic field theory and its application to electrical circuit design. Students will develop skills in calculating electric and magnetic fields, understanding transmission lines, and applying Maxwell’s equations to analyze wave propagation – essential for roles in power systems, communications, and signal processing. This course provides a strong foundation for advanced studies and practical engineering applications.

name: Modern Physics(I)
description: Explore the foundational principles of modern physics essential for advanced electrical engineering applications, including quantum mechanics, statistical mechanics, and wave-particle duality. Develop skills in analyzing semiconductor behavior, understanding optical properties of materials, and applying these concepts to circuit design and photonics. This course prepares students for roles in emerging technologies demanding a strong understanding of physics-based device characteristics.

name: Fundamentals of Liquid Crystal Display
description: Analyze the electrical and optical principles underpinning Liquid Crystal Display (LCD) technology, focusing on driving schemes, multiplexing techniques, and gamma correction circuit design. Students will develop skills in modeling LCD behavior and applying fundamental circuit analysis to optimize display performance for modern applications. This course prepares students for roles in display engineering, consumer electronics, and related fields.

name: Fourier Transform Theory and Applications
description: Analyze signals and systems using Fourier Transform techniques essential for electrical engineering applications, including spectral analysis, filter design, and communication systems. Students will develop proficiency in applying Fourier series, Fourier transforms, and inverse transforms to solve circuit problems and understand frequency domain representations. This course prepares students for roles in signal processing, control systems, and related engineering fields.

name: Photonics Industry
description: Explore the rapidly evolving photonics industry with a focus on electrical engineering principles underpinning optical communication and laser systems. Students will develop skills in optical circuit design, modulation techniques, and photodetector analysis, preparing them for roles in fiber optics, sensing, and advanced optical technologies. This course bridges theoretical knowledge with practical applications essential for a successful career in the photonics sector.

name: Sensors and Their Applications
description: Explore the fundamental principles of sensor operation and interface circuits essential for modern electrical engineering applications. Students will design and analyze analog and digital signal conditioning circuits, learn about common sensor types like strain gauges and accelerometers, and gain practical experience with data acquisition systems. This course prepares students for roles in instrumentation, automation, and embedded systems development.

name: Optoelectronics Engineering Practices
description: Develop practical skills in optoelectronic circuit design, analysis, and testing through hands-on laboratory experiences. This course emphasizes applying electrical engineering fundamentals to build and characterize circuits utilizing photodiodes, LEDs, and optical sensors. Students will gain proficiency in circuit simulation software and data analysis techniques essential for careers in optoelectronics and related fields.

name: Introduction to Semiconductor Physics
description: Explore the fundamental physics governing semiconductor behavior, essential for modern electrical engineering and circuit design. Students will analyze energy bands, carrier transport, and p-n junction characteristics to understand device operation and build a foundation for advanced semiconductor device analysis. This course equips students with the core knowledge needed for careers in electronics, VLSI design, and related fields.

name: Fundamental Computer Programming - Introduction to Data Analysis
description: Develop foundational programming skills in Python to analyze data relevant to business decision-making. Students will learn data manipulation with Pandas, data visualization using Matplotlib, and basic statistical analysis techniques applied to real-world management challenges. This course equips future managers with the analytical capabilities increasingly demanded in today’s data-driven business environment.

name: Introduction to Computer Software and Applications
description: Explore fundamental computer software and applications essential for modern business operations, with a focus on management principles. Students will develop proficiency in spreadsheet software, database fundamentals, and presentation tools to analyze data and communicate effectively. This course equips learners with practical skills directly applicable to various roles within the College of Management and beyond.

name: Innovation Management and Practice
description: Explore the principles and practices of innovation management, equipping students with the skills to drive organizational growth and competitive advantage. This course develops proficiency in techniques like Design Thinking, Lean Startup methodologies, and intellectual property management, applied to real-world business challenges. Students will learn to cultivate innovative cultures and effectively translate ideas into viable products and services within a Vietnamese business context.

name: Digital Innovation & Service
description: Explore the application of digital technologies to enhance service delivery and drive innovation within modern organizations. This course equips students with practical skills in data analytics, customer relationship management (CRM) systems, and process automation to optimize business operations. Through case studies and hands-on projects, students will learn to strategically leverage digital tools for competitive advantage and improved customer experiences.

name: Python Application and Management
description: Develop practical skills in Python programming to address common business challenges, focusing on data analysis with Pandas, data visualization using Matplotlib, and automation of managerial tasks. This course equips students with the ability to build and deploy Python-based solutions for data-driven decision-making and efficient workflow management within organizational contexts. CM247 emphasizes applying programming concepts to real-world case studies relevant to the College of Management curriculum.

name: Python Programming
description: Develop foundational Python programming skills applicable to modern business challenges. This course introduces data analysis with Pandas, data visualization using Matplotlib, and automation techniques for streamlining management tasks. Students will learn to leverage Python for data-driven decision-making and improved operational efficiency within a business context.

name: Web Crawler and Artificial Intelligence: The Application in Investment
description: Analyze the application of web crawling and artificial intelligence techniques – including Python scripting, data scraping, and machine learning – to extract and interpret financial data for investment decision-making. This course equips students with practical skills to build and deploy web crawlers, process large datasets, and develop data-driven investment strategies within a business context. Students will explore real-world case studies and develop a foundational understanding of algorithmic trading and portfolio optimization.

name: Deep Learning
description: Explore the application of deep learning techniques – including neural networks, convolutional neural networks, and recurrent neural networks – to solve complex business problems and drive data-driven decision-making. This course equips students with the practical skills to implement and evaluate deep learning models for tasks like predictive analytics, customer segmentation, and process optimization within a management context. Develop a strategic understanding of how to leverage AI for competitive advantage and improved organizational performance.

name: Digital Technology and Marketing
description: Explore the strategic application of digital technologies to modern marketing challenges within a business context. This course equips students with practical skills in areas like SEO, social media analytics, and content management systems to develop and implement effective digital marketing campaigns. CM267 prepares future managers to leverage data-driven insights and emerging technologies for competitive advantage.

name: Big Data Management and Statistical Analysis
description: Analyze and apply big data techniques to solve complex business challenges using tools like Hadoop, SQL, and statistical modeling. This course equips students with the skills to extract actionable insights from large datasets, informing strategic decision-making and improving organizational performance. Students will develop proficiency in data mining, predictive analytics, and data visualization for effective management reporting.

name: Accounting Information System
description: Explore the integration of accounting principles with information technology in CM418: Accounting Information Systems. Students will analyze how businesses leverage systems like Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), database management, and data analytics to improve financial reporting, internal controls, and decision-making. This course equips future accounting and management professionals with practical skills for designing, implementing, and evaluating modern accounting systems.

name: Financial Packages and Applications
description: Analyze and construct comprehensive financial packages utilizing discounted cash flow analysis, sensitivity analysis, and loan amortization modeling. This course equips students with practical skills in financial statement analysis and capital budgeting techniques essential for informed business decision-making and effective financial management. Students will apply these concepts to real-world scenarios, preparing them for roles in corporate finance, investment banking, and financial planning.

name: Big Data Analysis and Marketing Research
description: Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights for strategic marketing decisions in this hands-on course. Students will develop proficiency in data mining, predictive modeling using techniques like regression, and data visualization tools to optimize marketing campaigns and enhance customer relationship management. CM484 equips future business leaders with the analytical skills demanded in today’s data-driven marketplace.

name: FinTech Maker
description: Explore the rapidly evolving world of Financial Technology (FinTech) and its impact on modern business models through CM486. This course equips students with practical skills in blockchain fundamentals, data analytics for financial forecasting, and API integration to develop innovative FinTech solutions. Students will apply management principles to analyze, design, and potentially prototype new FinTech ventures, preparing them for careers in this dynamic industry.

name: Fundamental Computer Programming- C++ Lab(I)
description: Develop foundational programming skills in C++ through hands-on laboratory exercises, focusing on core computer science principles like data types, control structures, and algorithmic problem-solving. This course equips students with the essential tools for software development and prepares them for more advanced programming coursework and industry applications. Students will gain practical experience in debugging and implementing basic C++ programs.

name: Fundamental Computer Programming- C++ Lab(I) - English
description: Develop foundational programming skills in C++ with a hands-on laboratory approach, covering core concepts like data types, control structures, and function design. This course emphasizes algorithmic thinking and software development best practices, preparing students for further study in computer science and related fields. Students will gain practical experience translating problem solutions into executable code.

name: Fundamental Computer Programming- Web Programming (I)
description: Develop foundational programming skills essential for web development through this introductory course. Students will learn core computer science concepts, including algorithms, data structures, and control flow, while gaining practical experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This course prepares students for further study and careers in front-end web development and software engineering.

name: Fundamental Computer Programming(I)
description: Develop a foundational understanding of computer science principles and software development through hands-on programming experience. This course introduces fundamental programming concepts like data types, control structures, and algorithmic thinking using a popular programming language. Successful completion will equip students with essential skills for entry-level roles in software development and related fields.

name: Fundamental Computer Programming - Introduction to Data Analysis
description: Develop foundational programming skills in Python to analyze business data and support informed decision-making. Students will learn data manipulation with Pandas, data visualization using Matplotlib, and basic statistical analysis techniques applicable to management challenges. This course equips future managers with the analytical capabilities increasingly demanded in today’s data-driven business environment.
